Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: No, RaspberryPi StingMiner image has default username and password for raspbian lite which is pi/raspberry. First boot takes a bit of time since all required packages needs to be configured.  Remote access to system is disabled intentionally by default, so if you want to configure something manually in it, keyboard and display needs to be connected directly to Pi. In most cases you dont need to do anything - just plug ethernet cable and turn the power on.  Make sure you use latest image which is located here:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IVnNJU_BgzFkXWrRIaQRTmcw8qVLj6PB/view?usp=sharing  And thank you for your interest!

Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK

It's a low power Raspberry pi device or equivilient that sits in your network, and for every fingerprint of a hacker you report back, you get rewarded, so you are basically 'mining' hackers, not blocks.  So there is no need for a huge power supply and power draw.

Perhaps something like 'staking' or 'forging' would have been a better choice, as essentially the StingMiner functions much like a Masternode. It sits in your network and you get paid for uptime, and fingerprints of hackers successfully reported back to the network, there is no block solving going on, so it is the typical mining everyone expects.

Body: Actually hackers is not even the term used to describe someone using malicious means to gain access to a system or network. They are usually referred to as crackers. That's why we have the blackhat, greyhat and whitehat hacker's.

Author: shaykster
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Hi Guys,  I have been reading about the questions posed. Basically for those that are new to cyber security - the StingMiner which is the honeypot or tool that attacts hackers can run on virtually any platform. To start off with it will be on low powered systems like the raspberry pi or beagleboard. It can also run on normal machines (OS) but the idea is to have mass adoption. The power of this is the more StingMiners we have the better the threat detection capabilities. Once a threat is identified and validated using the AI engine in the backend this will be distributed to consumers and enterprises.  Consumers - the threat information will be available because BitFence plans to launch a personal firewall which will be integrated into the distributed network. Enterprises - they already use existing security solutions like Cisco / F5 etc and Bitfence will integrate into this.  The ICO is a strong business case covering cybersecurity which is a $202B industry and the cost of cybercrime topping $3T so you can do the maths.  The value of the HNY tokens will rise as more threat intelligence feeds become valuable - which means mass adoption. Also note due to the technical superiority of StingMiners we can target focused industries. For example: Autonomous Cars connected to the Internet - our StingMiner can emulate an infotainment system of a car using CAN bus. Hackers would think this is a car and try to run some attacks specifically targeting these protocols - which would identify them and fingerprint them. The same can be applied to any industry as they move to Internet of Things.....

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Please welcome Mr. Shah H Sheikh to our team as a senior cybersecurity advisor! And a VERY active one  Short Bio:  A dynamic, astute and professional individual with more than 10 years of industry expertise and experience. Having worked for service providers, cyber security system integrator and multiple vendors he has extensive knowledge on complete project life-cycle focused around cyber security services and solutions.  He graduated from King’s College London with a Master in Engineering (MEng) – Telecommunications and Data Network Engineering before joining Vodafone UK where he worked on multiple large scale core network and security projects across the different business units. He then moved onto Agilisys a leading IT services organization in the UK as a Network Security Team Lead providing Managed Security Services to end customers.  His tenure at Juniper Networks in the Middle East region was approximately 5 years working as a Sr. Security Consultant in Professional Services, having executed and delivered diverse range of security infrastructure projects across both Service Providers and Large Enterprise accounts across Europe, Middle East, Pakistan and Africa. Through strategic consulting combined with a lateral thinking approach he has established a trusted cyber security advisor status with many key accounts in the region.  Besides his technical expertise and certifications; he holds numerous professional qualifications – ISO27001, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CCSK, CPSA (CREST UK), GISCP along with many vendor specific technical certifications, he is an active member of ISACA and Cloud Security Alliance and has delivered many keynote speeches at major cyber security conferences.

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Thank you for your questions! It was answered on https://t.me/BitFence for everyones benefit, I'll copypaste it here:  To answer patent question, patent called "Decentralized system and method for cyber threat protection" and covers whole system design, sensor network, risk scoring engine, blockchain application. StingMiner is proprietary honeypot, based on several open source projects plus incorporates many best practices for honeypot design, not implemented anywhere in LGPL/BSD/Apache. Risk scoring engine is absolutely proprietary, it uses not only honeynet, but many open source threat sources, as well as our own database of threat signatures shaped as a pre-trained classifiers. Classifier training never stops, and by correlating various sources we can establish quality training set at any time. In addition to AI classifiers, such as SVM's we use of course multivariate rules engine which knows about severity of attack, possible impact, originating country, type of business attacked, etc...

Author: Darkoth89
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Lol they will never give up, does security cameras and police stop bank robbers? Nope.  Look at the current security solutions, there are very effective enterprise level products that stop external threats, but did you see in the news that a Las Vegas casino was hacked via a smart thermostat in a fish tank?  We need to be realistic, this is going to help in the fight again hackers, the honeypot will finger print and send out to the rest of the network, and their routers will block any further attacks, but it isn't going to 'make them give up'.  Maybe Bitfence should also do an educational series on cyber security in companies, like I said in a previous post, you can have all the security in the world, but if someone plugs in a USB, or gets tailgated into the office etc it's over.

Author: utclpn
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Still lots people are didn't understand about What’s zero-day attack? Nice description I found in white paper.  Zero-day attack happens once that flaw, or software/hardware vulnerability, is exploited and attackers release malware before a developer has an opportunity to create a software patch to fix the vulnerability—hence “zero-day.” Once a patch is written, issued and deployed, the exploit is no longer called a zero-day exploit. These attacks are rarely discovered right away. In fact, it often takes months and sometimes years before a developer learns of the vulnerability that led to an attack.

Author: Darkoth89
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Reading this thread it looks like so many people think this is going to be the end of hackers, it won't.  It'll be part of the solution if they do it right, you'll still need anti-virus on client machines, Firewalls and IPS devices, most importantly you'll still need to train your end users on security.  Bitfence won't stop Dave in Sales from plugging in that 'Cool USB' he found by his car and installing a backdoor.  The honeypot is going to be nice, but if it's placed inside your network and detects someone, your already in trouble.  I think the thing everything thinks is it's instantly going to stop all malicious users.

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Thank you for your questions! I'll do my best to clarify:  1. Yes, the miner software not only designed, but the Beta is ready. We initially targeted it for low power consumption ARM systems, but making it available  for all platforms, so it will run on Windows/Mac/Linux/BSD as well. It features auto-update, so we can keep our miner/honeypot always entertaining for hackers  2. AI engine is under active development now. Risk scoring part is ready, but we need to complete integration with mining pool for automated payouts  3. In most cases is easy. If you are running Linux server, it's trivial and done with chron / iptables. F5 and more complex architectures can be also configured pretty easy to digest threat feed. We'll have our integration service and assigned tech reps to help you achieve your goal.  4. Thats something we are planning to do. All products from our store will come with supporting documentation on multiple languages. We will implement ticket and CRM system as well

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: The only thing we have in common that we are both in "security" field  We are protecting not just from being infected by malicious viruses, but from all kind of external threats that may harm you - DDoS, attacks targeted to specific platform, sql injection, etc. And we are first to employ a blockchain-based distributed sensor network (honey-net) when we incentivize our "miners" to be eyes and ears of our system. Our system automatically learns about new threats and this information immediately pushed to subscribers, so they can be protected from this threat!  Please refer to our whitepaper for more details:  https://bitfence.io/data/BitFenceWP-EN-1.6b.pdf

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: If malicious actor tries to deploy malware on it's victim (our honeypot), we will quarantine it and submit to our threat intel engine. We know the "clean state" of honeypot and if attacker goes in somehow undetected, but changes honeypot state, we know that we got something valuable inside. We will have a fantastic malware/virus data bank very soon. We can further analyze it / match with other available databases of malware and quickly identify and prevent this infestation to a "real" system

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: You can run multiple miners, for sure, but in contrast with PoW mining your mining share in a pool not necessary would be double of what you can get from one miner. The miner reward is computed by uptime (minimum base rate) + actual threat data submitted to server. If no hackers attack detected, mining profit would be a double of base rate, but if one of the miner got hacker attack recorded/reported (similar to finding "block" in PoW), that particular one will get much bigger reward.  Distribution of hardware would be accomplished through a regional channel partners. We can get a good rate on BitFence branded Arm mini-computers and will provide software on SD cards lockable to serial number of device.

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: We call it "proof of threat". Each miner - either hardware (RaspberryPI, BeagleBone) or software, running on existing pc/mac - is a small, but powerful honeypot. It appears as valuable and relatively easy target for hackers. Therefore a name - StingMiner, as it resembles police sting operations. Hacker attacks the miner, and all available information about source of attack and attack nature is captured and transmitted to our threat intelligence engine.  If submission is determined by threat engine valuable (it was real hacker), miner rewarded with already minted ERC20 HNY tokens. And mined threat informationimmediately pushed to subscribers, who will be immediately protected from this and similar attacks.

Author: BitFence
Title: 🔥🔥🔥 [ANN][ICO] BITFENCE - REMOVE HACKERS FROM YOUR NETWORK
Body: Thank you, this is true. Biggest problem now is that threat scales faster and moves faster then protection from it. By giving incentive to community to join our network and become a sensor (StingMiner) in it, we will change that and that will give us unfair advantage over hackers!
